Node.definition: marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

= a person who has made himself available to be of service to others for a limited amount of time and in return for payment; who is usually paid daily, and his fragile rights are protected by the law; ≈ often used in metaphors expressing short and limited periods of time
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
literally: to pant after something; hence: = state in which humans wish strongly for something to happen

= a person who has made himself available to be of service to others for a limited amount of time and in return for payment; who is usually paid daily, and his fragile rights are protected by the law; ≈ often used in metaphors expressing short and limited periods of time

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
= process by which humans attain an enduring condition or status, ◄ as if it were a permanent gift
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= state in which objects or activities do not serve a valid purpose and can only lead to disappointment
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive
= process by which a certain condition lasts longer than expected or hoped

= the time of day when the sun starts going down, when people leave their work and go home, have food, and go to sleep; this is also the time of the evening sacrifice, and the time when an unclean person who has gone through the cleansing rituals is declared clean, when fasting and mourning come to an end, and when the exposed body of an executed person needs to be removed

Node.gloss: to be satisfied (with something)|to have one's fill (of something)
Node.definition: literally: to be satiated (with an event); hence: = process by which humans become more than fully engaged in a certain process or activity, which can be either good or bad
= action by which humans move from side to side or back and forth
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

Node.gloss: to be clothed > to be covered
Node.definition: = state in which objects are completely covered with a layer of other objects, such as plants, dirt, animals, ◄ as if it were a layer of clothing
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

= small, soft, legless, tube shaped creatures that have no bones or shells; they typically feed on overripe fruit, rotting meat, and similar things; most are larvae that hatch from the eggs laid by flies or some beetles; associated with uncleanness, mortality, decay, and death
= a compact mass, usually of indefinite size and shape
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface
= the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal

Node.gloss: to harden|to be broken|to be cracked
Node.definition: meaning unknown; literally, possibly: to find rest; hence: = process by which a relatively soft surface hardens|meaning unknown; possibly: = process by which a hard surface develops cracks
= process by which a wounded area become septic and starts producing pus
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= process by which an event takes place quickly and without delay
= small object with two pointed ends; ◄ part of weaving equipment; ► moves the thread of the weft across between threads of the warp; ≈ associated with swiftness

Node.gloss: to be finished|to be completed|to come to an end|to be past
Node.definition: = process by which an activity comes to full completion
= state of non existence of a person, place or event

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
literally: breath or wind; hence: = state in which an event does not last, but is over before one knows it

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= process by which humans perceive, either with their physical eyes or in a vision

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: to finish; hence: = process by which humans and objects completely disappear from existence
= a visible collection of condensed water vapor hanging in the atmosphere, often high above the ground ≈ also used to represent God's presence and activity
= process by which an object vanishes from existence

Node.gloss: to go down (to the netherworld)|to die
Node.definition: literally: to go down (to the netherworld, death, the pit, the dust, silence, etc.); hence: = process by which humans die and descend into the world of the dead

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to withhold|to hold back|to be reluctant
Node.definition: = action by which humans keep part of their body to themselves, refusing to use it to perform a particular event
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= action by which humans utter words with the focus on what is said
literally: bitter; hence: = state in which humans are in deep distress

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= mythical sea monster, such as behemoth (בְּהֵמֹות) and leviathan (לִוְיָתָן)

Node.gloss: to place (in a position) > to appoint
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities give (other) humans a certain task or responsibility

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
= a low platform standing on four legs, a bit longer than the length of a man, and about 70 80 centimeters wide
literally: to lift up; hence: = causative process by which a certain condition is made less intense
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to lack inner strength and courage
= process by which humans perceive a series of pictures and events in their minds; ≈ often regarded as a revelation from God; sometimes associated with things that disappear in a moment
= process by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
= causative process by which a specific event causes someone else to be in deep distress
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= process by which humans are being killed by someone else ◄ by having their air supply cut off

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= process by which humans or animals stop living
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

Node.gloss: to be alive|to become alive|to live
Node.definition: = to be alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

Node.gloss: to give up|to leave alone|to ignore
Node.definition: = action by which human or deities stop with an implicit action that affects (other) humans, animals, or objects
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= causative process by which humans or deities cause humans to increase in status, as a result of their authority, wealth, or wisdom

Node.gloss: to take to heart|to be concerned about
Node.definition: literally: to put (one's) heart on (something); hence: = to process information in one's mind, often with the intention to act upon it later
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well being, condition, and/or integrity
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= a very short length of time

= action by which humans or deities examine the character of other humans or deities by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
= action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= object of someone's aggression

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
literally: to bear; hence: = action by which humans or deities let go of any anger or resentment with regard to the wrongdoing or sin of (other) humans
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
